Nov 6, 2023

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
$120,000 from the General Fund Traffic, Parking and Transportation Salary and Wages account to
the General Fund Traffic, Parking and Transportation Travel and Training (Judgment and Damages)
account.
CMA 2023 #266
RESULT:
APPROPRIATION ADOPTED CMA PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

2. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report #23-61,
regarding the demographic information of dues-paying members of the municipal golf course.
CMA 2023 #267
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 2

Nov 6, 2023

3. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report Item
Number 23-65, regarding a phased ban on the use of gas-powered leaf blowers in Cambridge
CMA 2023 #268
RESULT:
LEAF BLOWER ORDINANCE LANGUAGE PASSED TO A SECOND
READING [9-0-0]
Next: 11/20/2023 5:30 PM

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

RESULT:
FINALIZED IN COUNCIL NOVEMBER 6, 2023 [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

RESULT:
REFERED TO THE ORDINANCE COMMITTEE [9-0-0]
Next: 11/28/2023 5:30 PM

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

RESULT:
CMA PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

A. An Ordinance 2023 #10 has been received from City Clerk, relative to the Municipal Code of the
City of Cambridge be amended in Chapter 8.16.081, Leaf Blowers
ORD 2023 # 10
RESULT:
PASSED TO A SECOND READING [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 3

Next: 11/20/2023 5:30 PM

Nov 6, 2023

4. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to an additional response to
Calendar Item No. 1 (POR 2023-97) of June 5, 2023, requesting that the City Manager work with the
Law Department and Human Rights Commission and all other Relevant Departments to Provide
Comments on the Draft Amendments to the Cambridge Human Rights Ordinance and the Cambridge
Fair Housing Ordinance.
CMA 2023 #269
RESULT:
MOTION TO ACCEPT THE AMENDMENTS TO ORDINANCE #8
SUGGESTED BY CITY STAFF IN CMA 2023 #269 [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

RESULT:
MOTION TO PLACE CMA 2023 #269 ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

5. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report Item
Number 23-63, regarding a proposed Home Rule Petition relative to amendments to the Fair Housing
Ordinance.
CMA 2023 #270
RESULT:
MOTION TO ACCEPT THE AMENDMENTS TO ORDINANCE #8
SUGGESTED BY CITY STAFF IN CMA 2023 #270
[9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

RESULT:

[9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 4

Nov 6, 2023

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. An application was received from Nina Quinlan, requesting permission for a curb cut at the
premises numbered 63 Sixth Street said petition has received approval from Inspectional
Services, Traffic, Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works.
Response has been received from the neighborhood association.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR NOLAN
IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 30, 2023
APP 2023 #55
RESULT:
PLACED ON THE TABLE [7-2-0]

Next: 11/20/2023 5:30 PM

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Mayor Siddiqui

NAYS:
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Zondervan

2. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Law Department and other relevant City
departments and prepare a report regarding the efficacy of establishing a dual reporting system
for the Director of Public Health, the process by which the City could establish by ordinance a
Commissioner of Public Health who would report directly to the City Manager, and the
reestablishment of a Health Policy Board.
POR 2023 #201
Councillor Nolan, Vice Mayor Mallon
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [5-4-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner,
Mayor Siddiqui

NAYS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 5

Nov 6, 2023

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
3. An Ordinance has been received from City Clerk, relative to proposed changes to Cannabis
Business Permitting Proposed Ordinance 2023-6.
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 16, 2023
TO BE ORDAINED ON OR AFTER NOVEMBER 7, 2023
ORD 2023 # 6
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 11/20/2023 5:30 PM

4. An Ordinance has been received from City Clerk, relative to 2.76.020 enacted is to protect the
human rights of all the residents of the City Protect Family Inclusion and Relationship Diversity
PASSED TO A SECOND READING OCTOBER 2 2023
ELIGIABLE TO BE ORDAINED
ORD 2023 # 8
RESULT:
FURTHER AMENDED ON NOVEMBER 6, 2023 AND BIFURCATED
INTO PARTS 8A AND 8B [9-0-0]
Next: 11/20/2023 5:30 PM

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

A. ORDD-2023-8A : Ordinance 2023 #8A Amend Chapter 2.76 – Human Rights Commission
ORDD-2023-8A
RESULT:
UNFINISHED BUSINESS
Next: 11/20/2023 5:30 PM

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

B. ORDD-2023-8B : Ordinance 2023 #8B Amend Chapter 14.04 – Fair Housing
ORDD-2023-8B
RESULT:
UNFINISHED BUSINESS

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 6

Next: 11/20/2023 5:30 PM

Nov 6, 2023

5. An Ordinance has been received from City Clerk, relative to a Zoning Petition by the Cambridge
City Council to amend Articles 2.000, 4.000, 5.000, and 23.000 of the Cambridge Zoning
Ordinance for the purpose of allowing henkeeping as a permitted accessory use to principal
residential (excluding transient accommodations as defined in Section 4.31.i), religious, and
educational uses; with limitations and subject to regulation and permitting by the Cambridge
Public Health Department.
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 16, 2023
TO BE ORDAINED ON OR AFTER NOVEMBER 7, 2023
EXPIRES JANUARY 8, 2024
ORD 2023 # 9
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 7

Next: 11/20/2023 5:30 PM

Nov 6, 2023

PAGE 10

Nov 6, 2023

V. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Manager is requested to more fully explore the Commonwealth’s recommendations
from the Separated Bike Lane document, especially for all squares and along small business districts,
schools, and key park entries, and with a focus also on the integration of pedestrian and biking
infrastructure.
POR 2023 #202
Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

2. That the City Manager be and is hereby requested to direct CDD, the Law Department and any other
relevant Departments to review this citizens zoning petition and provide any recommendations in
writing to the Ordinance Committee on November 29, 2023.
POR 2023 #203
Councillor McGovern, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

3. World Children's Day
POR 2023 #204
Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

4. Stomach Cancer Awareness Day
POR 2023 #205
Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 11

Nov 6, 2023

5. Transgender Day of Remembrance
POR 2023 #206
Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

6. Policy Order Re Inman Square Apartments
POR 2023 #207
Councillor Simmons, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Councillor

RESULT:

YEAS:
